disks.description: Virtual disks are used to store instance-local data which includes the operating system.

hidden.description: TODO operations that will not ship to customers

images.description: Images are read-only virtual disks that may be used to boot virtual machines.

instances.description: Virtual machine instances are the basic unit of computation. These operations are used for provisioning, controlling, and destroying instances.

ip-pools.description: IP Pools contain external IP addresses that can be assigned to virtual machine instances.

vpcs.description: Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs) provide isolated network environments for managing and deploying services.

projects.description: Projects are a grouping of associated resources such as instances and disks within a silo for purposes of billing and access control.

roles.description: Roles are a component of Identity and Access Management (IAM) that allow a user or agent account access to additional permissions.

sagas.description: Sagas are the abstraction used to represent multi-step operations within the Oxide deployment. These operations can be used to query saga status and report errors.

session.description: Information pertaining to the current session.

silos.description: Silos represent a logical partition of users and resources.

snapshots.description: Snapshots of virtual disks at a particular point in time.

system/hardware.description: These operations pertain to hardware inventory and management. Racks are the unit of expansion of an Oxide deployment. Racks are in turn composed of sleds, switches, power supplies, and a cabled backplane.

system/metrics.description: Metrics provide insight into the operation of the Oxide deployment. These include telemetry on hardware and software components that can be used to understand the current state as well as to diagnose issues.

system/silos.description: Silos represent a logical partition of users and resources.

system/update.description: This includes operations related to system updates.
